did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: Howard Kester "The Lynching of Claude Neal" Report, 1934
did.repository: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Reprint of Howard Kester's report "The Lynching of Claude Neal."

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: An excerpt from the report: "Kester was active in the formation of an inter-racial student movement in the south in the late '20s and early '30s. He was an active organizer of the Southern Tenant Farmers Union 1935- 1940. In 1936, he wrote "Revolt Among the Sharecroppers,' now available as a reprint. He founded the Committee of Southern Churchmen and spent most of his active years as an educator. He retired in 1971, while Dean of Students at Montreat-Anderson College in North Carolina."

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Reprint of Howard Kester's report "The Lynching of Claude Neal," published by the Southern Rural Welfare Association. The report was originally published by the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People (NAACP) on November 30, 1934.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions:
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.
